pli-tv-bi-vb-pc44:0.2: The nuns’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc44:0.3: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc44:0.5: 44. The training rule on providing services for householders
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc44:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc44:1.2: At that time the nuns were providing services for householders.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc44:1.3: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized them,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc44:1.4: “How can nuns provide services for householders?” …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc44:1.5: “Is it true, monks, that nuns do this?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc44:1.8: “… How can nuns provide services for householders?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc44:1.9: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc44:1.10: And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule thus:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc44:1.11: ‘If a nun provides services for a householder, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc44:2.1.4: … The nun who has been given the full ordination by both complete Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc44:2.1.6: if she cooks rice-porridge, a meal, or non-staple food for a lay person, or she washes clothes or a turban for them, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc44:2.2.2: if it is a rice-porridge drink;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc44:2.2.3: if it is a meal for the Sangha;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc44:2.2.4: if it is to venerate a stupa;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc44:2.2.5: if she cooks rice-porridge, a meal, or non-staple food for her own service-provider, or she washes clothes or a turban for them;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc44:2.2.7: if she is the first offender.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc44:2.2.8: The fourth training rule is finished.
